setShowShare.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowShare showShare}. Indicates that Share is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs. Share allows you to share variants with other users. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowShare: type: boolean, description: New value for property showShare

getShowSaveAs.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSaveAs showSaveAs}. Determine the visibility of the 'Save As' button in the variant list control. Default value is true.

sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new VariantManagement. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowExecuteOnSelection showExecuteOnSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowShare showShare} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSetAsDefault showSetAsDefault} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFavorites showFavorites} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIndustrySolutionMode industrySolutionMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVendorLayer vendorLayer} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getManualVariantKey manualVariantKey} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSave showSave} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSaveAs showSaveAs} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowManage showManage} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowVariantListFooter showVariantListFooter} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getInErrorState inErrorState} : boolean (default: false)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getFor for} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:save save} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:manage manage} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getShowExecuteOnSelection.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowExecuteOnSelection showExecuteOnSelection}. Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs. Default value is false.

parameters.bCreateAlways: type: boolean, description: in case this is set to true the former dialog will be destroyed, before a new one is created.

detachManage.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:manage manage} event of this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

getIndustrySolutionMode.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getIndustrySolutionMode industrySolutionMode}. If set totrue, the scenario is an industry-specific solution.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios. Default value is false.

getFor.!description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association {@link #getFor for}.

attachSave.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:save save} event of this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement itself. This event is fired when the Save Variant dialog is closed with OK for a variant.
attachSave.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement itself

attachManage.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:manage manage} event of this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement itself. This event is fired when users apply changes to variants in the Manage Variants dialog.
attachManage.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement itself

addFor.!description: Adds some for into the association {@link #getFor for}.

parameters.vFor: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The for to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

setShowManage.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowManage showManage}. Determine the visibility of the 'Manage' button in the variant list control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowManage: type: boolean, description: New value for property showManage

getManualVariantKey.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getManualVariantKey manualVariantKey}. If set totrue, the key for a vendor variant will be added manually.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios. Default value is false.

setShowExecuteOnSelection.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowExecuteOnSelection showExecuteOnSelection}. Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowExecuteOnSelection: type: boolean, description: New value for property showExecuteOnSelection

getVendorLayer.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getVendorLayer vendorLayer}. Indicates if the vendor layer is active.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios. Default value is false.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement.

attachCancel.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:cancel cancel} event of this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog itself. This event will be fired when the user clicks the Cancel button on the dialog.
attachCancel.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog itself

extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

setPkg.!description: An ABAP package that can be used as default for the ABAP package selection. The property can only be set once and afterwards it cannot be changed.

parameters.sPackage: type: string, description: an ABAP package that can be used as default for the ABAP package selection.

sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new transport/TransportDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPkg pkg} : string
    • {@link #getTransports transports} : any
    • {@link #getLrepObject lrepObject} : any
    • {@link #getHidePackage hidePackage} : boolean
  • Events
    • {@link #event:ok ok} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Dialog#constructor sap.m.Dialog} can be used as well.

setTransports.!description: The set of ABAP transport requests that can be selected by a user.

parameters.aSelection: type: array, description: the set of ABAP transport requests that can be selected by a user.

getTransports.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTransports transports}.

The set of ABAP transport requests that can be selected by a user.

detachOk.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:ok ok} event of this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

fireCancel.!description: Fires event {@link #event:cancel cancel} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

fireOk.!description: Fires event {@link #event:ok ok} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog.!description: The Transport Dialog Control can be used to implement a value help for selecting an ABAP package and transport request. It is not a generic utility, but part of the Variantmanament and therefore cannot be used in any other application.

getHidePackage.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHidePackage hidePackage}.

Flag indicating whether the selection of an ABAP package is to be hidden or not.

getLrepObject.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLrepObject lrepObject}.

The LREP object for which as transport request has to be selected

detachCancel.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:cancel cancel} event of this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

setLrepObject.!description: The LREP object for which as transport request has to be selected. The property can only be set once and afterwards it cannot be changed.

parameters.oObject: type: object, description: an LREP object for which as transport request has to be selected. The object has the attributes name, namespace and type.

attachOk.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:ok ok} event of this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog itself. This event will be fired when the user clicks the OK button on the dialog.
attachOk.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog itself

setHidePackage.!description: Flag indicating whether the selection of an ABAP package is to be hidden or not.

parameters.bHide: type: boolean, description: if set to true, the package selection is hidden.

getPkg.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getPkg pkg}.

An ABAP package that can be used as default for the ABAP package selection.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog.

sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog.!helpDescription: The Transport Dialog Control can be used to implement a value help for selecting an ABAP package and transport request. It is not a generic utility, but part of the Variantmanament and therefore cannot be used in any other application.

parameters.oChange: type: sap.ui.fl.Change, description: the change for which the transport information should be retrieved

setTransports.!description: Sets the transports for all changes.

parameters.oControl: type: object, description: object of the root control for the transport

selectTransport.!description: Selects a transport request for a given LREP object. First checks if the Adaptation Transport Organizer (ATO) is enabled If ATO is enabled and the layered repository object is in the CUSTOMER layer, the request 'ATO_NOTIFICATION' has to be used. This request triggers in the back end that the change is added to an ATO collection. If ATO is not enabled or LREP object not in CUSTOMER layer: If the LREP object is already assigned to an open transport request or the LREP object is assigned to a local ABAP package, no dialog to select a transport is started. Instead the success callback is invoked directly. The transport dialog is shown if a package or a transport request has still to be selected, so if more than one transport request is available for the current user and the LREP object is not locked in an open transport request.
selectTransport.!type: fn(oObjectInfo: Object, fOkay: fn(), fError: fn(), bCompactMode: Boolean, oControl: Object)

parameters.fError: type: function, description: call-back to be invoked when an error occurred during selection of a transport request.
parameters.bCompactMode: type: boolean, description: flag indicating whether the transport dialog should be opened in compact mode.
parameters.oObjectInfo: type: object, description: the LREP object, which has the attributes name, name space, type, layer and package.
parameters.fOkay: type: function, description: call-back to be invoked when a transport request has successfully been selected.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

state.!description: The state affects the icon and the title color. If other than "None" is set, a predefined icon will be added to the dialog. Setting icon property will overwrite the predefined icon. The default value is "None" which doesn't add any icon to the Dialog control. This property is by now only supported by blue crystal theme.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

type.!description: The type of the dialog. In some themes, the type "message" will limit the dialog's width within 480px on tablet and desktop.

horizontalScrolling.!description: Indicates if user can scroll horizontally inside dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as direct child added to dialog. If there is, dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

title.!description: Title text appears in the dialog header.

contentHeight.!description: Preferred height of content in Dialog. If the preferred height is bigger than the available space on screen, it will be overwritten by the maximum available height on screen in order to make sure that dialog isn't cut off.

transports.!description: The set of ABAP transport requests that can be selected by a user.

resizable.!description: Indicates whether the dialog is resizable. the dialog is resizable. If this property is set to true, the dialog will have a resize handler in it's bottom right corner. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be resizable only in desktop mode.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

icon.!description: Icon displayed in the dialog's header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it's density aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.

verticalScrolling.!description: Indicates if user can scroll vertically inside dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as direct child added to dialog. If there is, dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

lrepObject.!description: The LREP object for which as transport request has to be selected

stretchOnPhone.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.13.1 Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with jQuery.device.is.phone, then dialog is only stretched when runs on phone.
Determines whether the dialog will displayed on full screen on a phone.

pkg.!description: An ABAP package that can be used as default for the ABAP package selection.

hidePackage.!description: Flag indicating whether the selection of an ABAP package is to be hidden or not.

contentWidth.!description: Preferred width of content in Dialog. This property affects the width of dialog on phone in landscape mode, tablet or desktop, because the dialog has a fixed width on phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of dilaog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of dialog width on tablet is 400px.

escapeHandler.!description:
This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behaviour which will be executed when the ESCAPE key is pressed. By default when the ESCAPE key is pressed the Dialog is immediately closed.

showHeader.!description: Determines whether the header is shown inside the dialog. If this property is set to true, the text and icon property are ignored. This property has a default value true.

stretch.!description: Determines if the dialog will be stretched to full screen. This property is only applicable to standard dialog and message type dialog ignores this property.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

draggable.!description: Indicates whether the dialog is draggable. If this property is set to true, the dialog will be draggable by it's header. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be draggable only in desktop mode.

createNew.!type: fn(sReference: String, oInlineChange: Object, sLayer: String, oAppComponent: Object) -> Promise

parameters.oAppComponent: type: object, description: application component to get the version from
parameters.sLayer: type: string, description: layer of the descriptor change
parameters.sReference: type: string, description: the descriptor id for which the change is created
parameters.oInlineChange: type: object, description: the inline change instance

sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportSelection_o.!type: fn(Utils: sap.ui.fl.Utils, Transports: sap.ui.fl.transport.Transports, TransportDialog: sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog, FlexSettings: sap.ui.fl.registry.Settings)

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.model.json.JSONModel.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getCurrentVariantReference.!description: Returns the current variant for a given variant management control

parameters.sVariantManagementReference: type: String, description: The variant management Ref

sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel.!constructorDescription:
/**
Constructor for a new sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel model.

_switchToVariant.!description: Returns the variants for a given variant management Ref

parameters.sVariantManagementReference: type: String, description: The variant management Ref
parameters.sNewVariantReference: type: String, description: The newly selected variant Ref

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantModel.

update.!description: Update a change or variant via REST call.
update.!type: fn(oPayload: Object, sChangeName: String, sChangelist: String, bIsVariant: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.oPayload: type: Object, description: The content which is send to the server
parameters.sChangeName: type: String, description: Name of the change
parameters.sChangelist: type: String, description: (optional) The transport ID.

loadChanges.!description: Loads the changes for the given component class name.

parameters.mPropertyBag: type: map, description: Contains additional data needed for reading changes
parameters.oComponent: type: object, description: Contains component data needed for reading changes

attachSentRequest.!description: Registers a callback for a sent request to the back end. The callback is only called once for each change. Each call is done with an object similar to the resolve of the promises containing a status of the response from the back end i.e. success, a response containing the change processed in this request

parameters.fCallback: type: function, description: function called after all related promises are resolved

send.!description: Send a request to the back end
send.!type: fn(sUri: String, sMethod: String, oData: Object, mOptions: Object) -> Promise

parameters.sUri: type: String, description: Relative URL for this request
parameters.mOptions: type: Object, description: Additional options which should be used in the request
parameters.oData: type: Object, description: Payload of the request
parameters.sMethod: type: String, description: HTTP-method to be used by this request (default GET)

sap.ui.fl.LrepConnector.!constructorDescription: Provides the connectivity to the ABAP based LRep REST-service

detachSentRequest.!description: Deregisters a callback for a sent request to the back end if the callback was registered

parameters.fCallback: type: function, description: function called after all related promises are resolved

getFileAttributes.!description: Retrieves the file attributes for a given resource in the LREP.
getFileAttributes.!type: fn(sNamespace: String, sName: String, sType: String, sLayer: String) -> Object

parameters.sNamespace: type: String, description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change. Default LREP namespace is "localchange".
parameters.sType: type: String, description: File type extension
parameters.sName: type: String, description: Name of the change

create.!description: Creates a change or variant via REST call.
create.!type: fn(oPayload: Object, sChangelist?: String, bIsVariant: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.oPayload: type: Object, description: The content which is send to the server
parameters.sChangelist: type: String, description: The transport ID.

upsert.!description: Upserts a given change or variant via REST call.
upsert.!type: fn(sNamespace: String, sName: String, sType: String, sLayer: String, sContent: String, sContentType: String, sChangelist: String) -> Object

parameters.sNamespace: type: String, description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change.
parameters.sContent: type: String, description: File content to be saved as string
parameters.sType: type: String, description: File type extension
parameters.sName: type: String, description: Name of the change
parameters.sChangelist: type: String, description: The transport ID, optional
parameters.sContentType: type: String, description: Content type (e.g. application/json, text/plain, ...), default: application/json

getStaticResource.!description: Authenticated access to a resource in the Lrep
getStaticResource.!type: fn(sNamespace: String, sName: String, sType: String, bIsRuntime: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.sNamespace: type: String, description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change. Default LREP namespace is "localchange".
parameters.bIsRuntime: type: Boolean, description: The stored file content is handed over to the lrep provider that can dynamically adjust the content to the runtime context (e.g. do text replacement to the users' logon language) before
parameters.sType: type: String, description: File type extension
parameters.sName: type: String, description: Name of the change

deleteChange.!description: Delete a change or variant via REST call.

parameters.bIsVariant: type: Boolean, description: is it a variant?

setRequestUrlPrefix.!description: Prefix for request URL can be set in exceptional cases when consumer needs to add a prefix to the URL

parameters.sRequestUrlPrefix: type: String, description: request URL prefix which must start with a (/) and must not end with a (/)

listContent.!description: Retrieves the content for a given namespace and layer via REST call.

parameters.sNamespace: type: String, description: The file namespace goes here. It is needed to identify the change.

deleteFile.!description: Delete a file via REST call.
deleteFile.!type: fn(sNamespace: String, sName: String, sType: String, sLayer: String, sChangelist: String) -> Object

parameters.sNamespace: type: String, description: The abap package goes here. It is needed to identify the change.
parameters.sType: type: String, description: File type extension
parameters.sName: type: String, description: Name of the change
parameters.sChangelist: type: String, description: The transport ID, optional

createForExisting.!description: Creates a descriptor variant instance for an existing descriptor variant id

sap.ui.fl.descriptorRelated.api.Descript.!type: fn(sChangeType: String, mParameters?: Object, mTexts?: Object)

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.fl.transport.TransportDialog with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.m.Dialog.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

submit.!description: Submits the descriptor change to the backend

store.!description: Stores the descriptor change in change persistence

getJson.!description: Returns a copy of the JSON object of the descriptor change

showSaveAs.!description: Determine the visibility of the 'Save As' button in the variant list control.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

showSave.!description: Determine the visibility of the 'Save' button in the variant list control.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

manualVariantKey.!description:
If set totrue, the key for a vendor variant will be added manually.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios.

showFavorites.!description: Indicates if favorites can be created.

vendorLayer.!description:
Indicates if the vendor layer is active.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios.

showExecuteOnSelection.!description: Indicates that Execute on Selection is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

showShare.!description: Indicates that Share is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs. Share allows you to share variants with other users.

showManage.!description: Determine the visibility of the 'Manage' button in the variant list control.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

showSetAsDefault.!description: Indicates that set as default is visible in the Save Variant and the Manage Variants dialogs.

industrySolutionMode.!description:
If set totrue, the scenario is an industry-specific solution.
Node:This flag is only used internally in the app variant scenarios.

inErrorState.!description: Indicates that the control is in error state. If set to true error message will be displayed whenever the variant is opened.

showVariantListFooter.!description: Determine the visibility of the footer of the variant list.
